ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Acoustic Shock
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of sudden acoustic incident via headset, symptoms of pain and hyperacusis, and reduced LDLs despite normal pure-tone thresholds.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Phonophobia
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Specific anxiety and fear reaction regarding telephones following the acoustic incident.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess for acute acoustic trauma and hearing loss following the incident.
To assess middle ear function and rule out physical trauma to the tympanic membrane or ossicles.
Follow-up assessment to monitor thresholds and ensure no delayed hearing loss.
To objectively assess sound tolerance levels given complaints of hyperacusis and pain.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial assessment 2 days post-injury showed no evidence of permanent threshold shift or middle ear pathology. The patient was reassured that symptoms would likely settle.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal hearing thresholds (0-10 dB HL) across 250 Hz to 8 kHz.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Follow-up 1 month later confirmed persistent normal hearing thresholds but revealed significantly reduced sound tolerance (hyperacusis), particularly in the exposed right ear, supporting the diagnosis of acoustic shock.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Thresholds remained within normal limits (0-10 dB HL).

tests.name: Loudness Discomfort Levels (LDLs)
tests.result_summary: Abnormal LDLs. Right ear mean 73.75 dB HL (range 70-80 dB); Left ear mean 86.25 dB HL (range 80-95 dB).

proposed_items: Sound therapy using environmental sound enrichment (e.g., nature sounds)
Referral to clinical psychologist (via Occupational Health)
counseling_actions: Validate the patient's experience as a real condition (Acoustic Shock)
Explain that pain and sensitivity are due to temporary auditory processing changes, not permanent damage
Advise against silence or over-protection (earplugs) to prevent increasing sensitivity
Advise using environmental sound rather than ear-level sound generators initially

escalation.rationale_short: To address anxiety, phonophobia, and psychological distress related to the workplace incident.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor symptom resolution and return to daily activities.

expected_outcome: The patient continued to find the workplace problematic.
The patient eventually left her employment to set up a photography business.
